problem_text: m \angle BDJ = 7y+2, m \angle JDR = 2y+7, find the value of y.
logic_forms: Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(B, D, K)), MeasureOf(Angle(R, D, J)))
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: ∠CDF, ∠RDC, ∠FDJ, ∠JDE, ∠KDF, pi * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180) = ∠RDJ, B on DF, 3.14 = pi, ∠KDB = ∠RDJ, ∠CDB, ∠FDC, ∠CDE, ∠FDR, DF ⊥ DR, pi * ((2 + 7 * y) / 180) = ∠JDB, ∠EDF, J on CD

Step 2:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠CDF, B on DF
Conclusions: ∠CDB = ∠CDF

Step 3:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠KDF, B on DF
Conclusions: ∠KDB = ∠KDF

Step 4:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠KDB = ∠RDJ, pi * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180) = ∠RDJ
Conclusions: pi * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180) = ∠KDB

Step 5:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠CDF, ∠FDR, ∠RDC
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠CDF + ∠FDR + ∠RDC

Step 6:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : DF ⊥ DR
Conclusions: (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠FDR

Step 7:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠JDE, ∠EDF, ∠FDJ
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠EDF + ∠FDJ + ∠JDE

Step 8:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠EDF, ∠CDE, ∠FDC
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠CDE + ∠EDF + ∠FDC

Step 9:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : J on CD, ∠RDC
Conclusions: ∠RDC = ∠RDJ

Step 10:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : J on CD, ∠CDF
Conclusions: ∠CDF = ∠JDF

Step 11:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : J on CD, ∠CDE
Conclusions: ∠CDE = ∠JDE

Step 12:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : J on CD, ∠FDC
Conclusions: ∠FDC = ∠FDJ

Step 13:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : J on CD, ∠CDB
Conclusions: ∠CDB = ∠JDB

Step 14:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180) = ∠KDB, ∠KDB = ∠KDF
Conclusions: pi * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180) = ∠KDF

Step 15:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠FDR, 2 * pi = ∠CDF + ∠FDR + ∠RDC, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = (3 * pi) / 2 + ∠CDF + ∠RDC

Step 16:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠RDC = ∠RDJ, pi * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180) = ∠RDJ
Conclusions: pi * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180) = ∠RDC

Step 17:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CDF = ∠JDF, ∠CDB = ∠CDF
Conclusions: ∠CDB = ∠JDF

Step 18:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, ∠CDE = ∠JDE, ∠FDC = ∠FDJ, 2 * pi = ∠CDE + ∠EDF + ∠FDC
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = ∠EDF + ∠FDJ + ∠JDE

Step 19:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : pi * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180) = ∠KDF, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180) = ∠KDF

Step 20:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((2 + 7 * y) / 180) = ∠JDB, ∠CDB = ∠JDF, ∠CDB = ∠JDB
Conclusions: pi * ((2 + 7 * y) / 180) = ∠JDF

Step 21:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = ∠EDF + ∠FDJ + ∠JDE, 2 * pi = ∠EDF + ∠FDJ + ∠JDE
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi

Step 22:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180) = ∠KDF, pi * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180) = ∠KDF
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180) = pi * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180)

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CDF = ∠JDF, pi * ((2 + 7 * y) / 180) = ∠JDF
Conclusions: pi * ((2 + 7 * y) / 180) = ∠CDF

Step 24:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi, 2 * 3.14 = (3 * pi) / 2 + ∠CDF + ∠RDC
Conclusions: 2 * pi = (3 * pi) / 2 + ∠CDF + ∠RDC

Step 25:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180) = ∠RDC, 3.14 * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180) = pi * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180)
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180) = ∠RDC

Step 26:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : pi * ((2 + 7 * y) / 180) = ∠CDF, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((2 + 7 * y) / 180) = ∠CDF

Step 27:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 2 * pi = (3 * pi) / 2 + ∠CDF + ∠RDC, 2 * 3.14 = (3 * pi) / 2 + ∠CDF + ∠RDC, 3.14 * ((7 + 2 * y) / 180) = ∠RDC, 3.14 * ((2 + 7 * y) / 180) = ∠CDF
Conclusions: 9 = y
logic_fomrs_refined: Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(K, D, B)), MeasureOf(Angle(R, D, J)))
Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(J, D, B)), Mul(pi, Div(Add(Mul(7.0, y), 2.0), 180.0)))
Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(R, D, J)), Mul(pi, Div(Add(Mul(2.0, y), 7.0), 180.0)))
